content:
Tooting my own horn.

I equaled my highest ever score today on Sqword: 37. The cool thing is though that on the anonymous leader-board there were only 6 people who got higher than 37. That's pretty good.

There is a large element of luck in the game. I got five points with my very last letter today because it allowed me to complete a five-letter word. The letters come up randomly, so that was a lucky break. Still, there's some skill involved as well.

content:
“Bathal vel Vathat super Abrac ruens,” Ben finished, louder, with all the command he could muster. Nervous sweat prickled down his brow, getting into his eyes. “Absor veniens super Aberer.“

Then it was done. And after that…

He wouldn’t say appeared, exactly. The chair he’d put in the triangle across from his own circle just seemed to be even more shadowed for a moment, more even than the low light of all

content:
On local well-posedness of the stochastic incompressible density-dependent Euler equations

Claudia Espitia, David A. C. Mollinedo, Christian Olivera
https://arxiv.org/abs/2406.06161 https://arxiv.org/pdf/2406.06161

arXiv:2406.06161v1 Announce Type: new
Abstract: In this paper we study the stochastic inhomogeneous incompressible Euler equations in the whole space $\mathbb{R}^3$. We show the existence and pathwise uniqueness of local solutions with a multiplicative stochastic noise. Our approach is based on reducing our problem to the random problem and some estimations for type transport equations.

card.title: On local well-posedness of the stochastic incompressible density-dependent Euler equations
card.description: In this paper we study the stochastic inhomogeneous incompressible Euler equations in the whole space $\mathbb{R}^3$. content:
Today's musical kick is #NineSparksRiots (aka Swedish trombonist Kristian Persson). I've been listening to his #music for a while; his groove is world-class, and the #trombone playing is outstanding. But what really stands out is his incredibly emotional use of #harmony and #melody.

This tune in particular (I Thought of You) hits me hard in the feels. It's hard to describe the feeling it elicits: something like the joy & wonder I get hanging out with my goddaughter.
